meanings.definition: Laypeople or non-professionals in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: The workshop was filled with laities eager to learn about gardening.
meanings.sent2: The laities at the conference asked insightful questions.
meanings.sent3: The laities tried their hand at painting, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: In the world of coding, the laities are the artists with a different brush.
meanings.sent5: The group of laities made the event lively and engaging.

meanings.definition: The general population or ordinary people, as opposed to experts or professionals.
meanings.sent1: The politician's speech resonated with the laities in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The store was bustling with laities doing their daily shopping.
meanings.sent3: The laities decided to have a picnic in the middle of the workday, much to their boss's surprise.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of fashion, the laities set the trends without even realizing it.
meanings.sent5: The laities' voices echoed through the town, united in their cause.
